nodes.bodyText: If gradle is supposed to downloaded needed toolchain, why do we provide it manually?

           - macos-latest
           - ubuntu-latest
           - windows-latest

-          - 11
         include:
           - os: ubuntu-latest
-            java: 11

             coverage: true
-          - os: ubuntu-latest
-            java: 8
     steps:
       - uses: actions/checkout@v2
         with:
           submodules: true
-      - uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+      - id: setup-java-8

nodes.bodyText:
Do you really need all?
Can you use bin distribution?

Back in the day -all was required for intellij completion from what I understand. Now I do see gradle compile stubs on first launch with -bin. Does that mean bin is enough for projects, but not plugin authors? If so it mostly makes sense - but I personally found the time it takes for -bin to generate stubs to be way longer (several minutes on a macbook pro) than just downloading -all so not sure it's a savings in practice. What do you think?

Oh, I thought -all was generating stubs as well. I did not compare the contents, however, I thought the difference is just source code (*.java files are present in -all, and they are not there in -bin).
I think -all was required earlier for the IDE to navigate to Gradle sources, however, it is not needed now.

https://twitter.com/CedricChampeau/status/1113871652809531392
If you are here, then there's Madrid JUG happening right NOW: https://www.meetup.com/madrid-gug/events/273721823
Modernizing the Groovy build by Cédric Champeau, so you can join and ask -bin vs -all :)

I think I noticed slowness with -bin with the generations of stubs that wasn't there with -all but am not sure, I'll need to try a controlled experiments to confirm.
And as much as I love Gradle I was supposed to pass out an hour ago and will promptly do so for tomorrow :) Sounds like a fun event for sure though.

Do you really need all?
Can you use bin distribution?
Are we sure that this image is being used? The line 25 defines executor type as machine which is VM and I think as it is applied at root all jobs will use it.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -28,8 +30,9 @@ jobs:
       # Configure the JVM and Gradle to avoid OOM errors
       _JAVA_OPTIONS: "-Xmx1g"
       GRADLE_OPTS: "-Dorg.gradle.daemon=false -Dorg.gradle.workers.max=2"
+      ORG_GRADLE_PROJECT_testAdditionalJavaVersions: true
     docker:
-      - image: circleci/openjdk:8-jdk
+      - image: circleci/openjdk:11.0.6-jdk-buster
